DOC.brief_summary: 10 healthy volunteers will undergo the controlled lowering of their blood glucose level at sea level and a simulated altitude of 8,000 feet, to test the hypothesis that continuous glucose monitoring system measurement of blood glucose is as accurate at altitude as at sea level.
DOC.brief_title: Performance of Continuous Glucose Monitoring Systems at Altitude
DOC.criteria: Age 18 60 years. No known medical conditions or concomitant medication. Pregnancy. Marine diving in preceding 24 hours. Unable to provide written informed consent.
